dependencies.description: A C library for parsing and emitting YAML.
dependencies.name: libyaml

dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.
dependencies.name: py-cython

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
The AMD System Management Interface Library, or AMD SMI library, is a C
library for Linux that provides a user space interface for applications
to monitor and control AMD device.
dependent_to.name: amdsmi

dependent_to.description:
AWS ParallelCluster is an AWS supported Open Source cluster management
tool to deploy and manage HPC clusters in the AWS cloud.
dependent_to.name: aws-parallelcluster

dependent_to.description:
This package provides a unified command line interface to Amazon Web
Services
dependent_to.name: awscli

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-CheSS: A module for performing Fermi Operator Expansions via
Chebyshev Polynomials.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-chess

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-core: the core components of BigDFT, an electronic structure
calculation based on Daubechies wavelets.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-core

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-futile: a library handling most common FORTRAN low-level
operations, like memory managment, profiling routines, I/O operations.
It also supports yaml output and parsing for fortran programs. It also
provides wrappers routines to MPI and linear algebra operations. This
library is intensively used in BigDFT packages.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-futile

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-Psolver: a flexible real-space Poisson Solver based on
Interpolating Scaling Functions. It constitutes a fundamental building
block of BigDFT code, and it can also be used separately and linked to
other codes.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-psolver

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-spred: a library for structure prediction tools, that is compiled
on top of BigDFT routines.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-spred

dependent_to.description: Bueno: Well-Provenanced Benchmarking
dependent_to.name: bueno

dependent_to.description: Bulker: multi-container environment manager
dependent_to.name: bulker

dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.
dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark

dependent_to.description:
CryoDRGN is a neural network based algorithm for heterogeneous cryo-EM
reconstruction. In particular, the method models a continuous
distribution over 3D structures by using a neural network based
representation for the volume
dependent_to.name: cryodrgn

dependent_to.description:
Container file creator, facilitating the generation of Dockerfiles and
Singularity definition files infused with OS packages, spack packages
and custom commands
dependent_to.name: e4s-alc

dependent_to.description:
Container Launcher for E4S containers, facilitating MPI library
translations
dependent_to.name: e4s-cl

dependent_to.description: Event data model of Key4hep.
dependent_to.name: edm4hep

dependent_to.description:
The Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF) is high-performance, flexible
software infrastructure for building and coupling weather, climate, and
related Earth science applications. The ESMF defines an architecture for
composing complex, coupled modeling systems and includes data structures
and utilities for developing individual models. The National Unified
Operational Prediction Capability (NUOPC) Layer defines a common model
architecture to support interoperable ESMF components. The NUOPC Layer
is included with the ESMF package.
dependent_to.name: esmf

dependent_to.description: A next-generation resource manager (pre-alpha)
dependent_to.name: flux-core

dependent_to.description: Python bindings for the flux resource manager API
dependent_to.name: flux-python

dependent_to.description: A scheduler for flux-core
dependent_to.name: flux-sched

dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework
dependent_to.name: gaudi

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Runtime is designed to
enhance energy efficiency of applications through active hardware
configuration.
dependent_to.name: geopm-runtime

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Service provides a user
interface for accessing hardware telemetry and settings securely. Note:
GEOPM interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs).
For proper usage make sure MSRs are made available via the msr or msr-
safe kernel modules by your administrator.
dependent_to.name: geopm-service

dependent_to.description:
GNU Radio is a free & open-source software development toolkit that
provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios. It can
be used with readily-available, low-cost external RF hardware to create
software-defined radios, or without hardware in a simulation-like
environment. It is widely used in hobbyist, academic, and commercial
environments to support both wireless communications research and real-
world radio systems.
dependent_to.name: gnuradio

dependent_to.description:
GPTune is an autotuning framework that relies on multitask and transfer
learnings to help solve the underlying black-box optimization problem
using Bayesian optimization methodologies.
dependent_to.name: gptune

dependent_to.description:
hipBLASLt is a library that provides general matrix-matrix operations
with a flexible API and extends functionalities beyond a traditional
BLAS library
dependent_to.name: hipblaslt

dependent_to.description:
hipSPARSELt is a SPARSE marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends. It sits between the application and a 'worker' SPARSE library,
marshalling inputs into the backend library and marshalling results back
to the application. hipSPARSELt exports an interface that does not
require the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend.
Currently, hipSPARSELt supports rocSPARSELt and cuSPARSELt v0.4 as
backends.
dependent_to.name: hipsparselt

dependent_to.description:
BEE is a workflow orchestration system designed to build containerized
HPC applications and orchestrate workflows across HPC and cloud systems.
BEE has adopted the Common Workflow Language (CWL) for specifying
workflows. Complex scientific workflows specified by CWL are managed and
visualized through a graph database, giving the user the ability to
monitor the state of each task in the workflow. BEE runs jobs using the
workload scheduler (i.e. Slurm or Flux) on the HPC system that tasks are
specified to run on.
dependent_to.name: hpc-beeflow

dependent_to.description: IsoQuant: Transcript discovery and quantification with long RNA reads
dependent_to.name: isoquant

dependent_to.description:
The Juelich benchmarking environment (JUBE) provides a script based
framework to easily create benchmark sets, run those sets on different
computer systems and evaluate the results.
dependent_to.name: jube

dependent_to.description: Tool to manage (m)ultiple git r(epo)sitories
dependent_to.name: mepo

dependent_to.description:
Mesa is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a
system for rendering interactive 3D graphics.
dependent_to.name: mesa

dependent_to.description:
MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database
program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like
documents with optional schemas.
dependent_to.name: mongodb

dependent_to.description: A python package with helper tools for the nf-core community.
dependent_to.name: nf-core-tools

dependent_to.description: A Python wrapper for the Seqera Platform CLI (formerly Tower CLI).
dependent_to.name: nf-seqerakit

dependent_to.description: Node Resource Manager
dependent_to.name: nrm

dependent_to.description: Advanced Profiling and Analytics for AMD Hardware
dependent_to.name: omniperf

dependent_to.description:
PODIO, or plain-old-data I/O, is a C++ library to support the creation
and handling of data models in particle physics.
dependent_to.name: podio

dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.
dependent_to.name: py-abipy

dependent_to.description:
A simple way to train and use PyTorch models with multi-GPU, TPU, mixed-
precision.
dependent_to.name: py-accelerate

dependent_to.description:
Ansible is a radically simple IT automation platform that makes your
applications and systems easier to deploy.
dependent_to.name: py-ansible

dependent_to.description: Advanced Normalization Tools in Python.
dependent_to.name: py-antspyx

dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Scientific Data Format (ASDF) is a next-generation
interchange format for scientific data. This package contains the Python
implementation of the ASDF Standard.
dependent_to.name: py-asdf

dependent_to.description: Some extensions to pyyaml.
dependent_to.name: py-aspy-yaml

dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.
dependent_to.name: py-astropy

Bakta: rapid & standardized annotation of bacterial genomes, MAGs &

dependent_to.name: py-bakta

dependent_to.description: Security oriented static analyser for python code.

dependent_to.description: Biobb_common is the base package required to use the biobb packages
dependent_to.name: py-biobb-common

dependent_to.description: Python library to optimize and evaluate electrical models.

bravado-core is a Python library that adds client-side and server-side

dependent_to.description:
CEKit is a Container image creation tool. CEKit helps to build container

dependent_to.description:
A code generator that fuses subsequent batched matrix multiplications

memory as long as necessary.
dependent_to.name: py-chainforgecodegen

dependent_to.description: Python Serverless Microframework for AWS.

dependent_to.description: A set of python tools for reading, writing and viewing Cinema databases

Scalable cluster administration Python framework - Manage node sets node

dependent_to.name: py-clustershell

cmake-format project provides Quality Assurance (QA) tools for cmake.

dependent_to.name: py-cmake-format

dependent_to.description: Conan C/C++ package manager
dependent_to.name: py-conan

dependent_to.description:
Helper functions for injecting a conda environment into the current

dependent_to.name: py-conda-inject

dependent_to.description:
A python package for making stacked area plots of contributions over

dependent_to.name: py-contrib

dependent_to.description:
A command-line utility that creates projects from cookiecutters (project
templates). E.g. Python package projects, jQuery plugin projects.
dependent_to.name: py-cookiecutter

dependent_to.description: coveralls.io is a service for publishing your coverage stats online.
dependent_to.name: py-coveralls

dependent_to.description:
DaCe is a fast parallel programming framework that takes code in
Python/NumPy and other programming languages, and maps it to high-
performance CPU, GPU, and FPGA programs, which can be optimized
programmatically or interactively.
dependent_to.name: py-dace

dependent_to.description: Pre- and post-processing tools for DAMASK
dependent_to.name: py-damask

dependent_to.description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytics.
dependent_to.name: py-dask

dependent_to.description: An analysis environment for satellite and other earth observation data.
dependent_to.name: py-datacube

dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.
dependent_to.name: py-datalad

dependent_to.description:
DataLad extension package for deprecated functionality that was phased
out in the core package.
dependent_to.name: py-datalad-deprecated

dependent_to.description: DataLad extension for semantic metadata handling
dependent_to.name: py-datalad-metalad

dependent_to.description:
Datasets is a lightweight library providing two main features: one-line
dataloaders for many public datasets and efficient data pre-processing.
dependent_to.name: py-datasets

dependent_to.description:
Scalable asynchronous hyperparameter optimization, neural architecture
search, and parallel ensemble of predictive models.
dependent_to.name: py-deephyper

dependent_to.description: Distributed scheduler for Dask
dependent_to.name: py-distributed

dependent_to.description: Donfig is a python library making package and script configuration easy
dependent_to.name: py-donfig

dependent_to.description:
dynim is a pure-python package to perform dynamic-importance (DynIm)
sampling on a high-dimensional data set.
dependent_to.name: py-dynim

dependent_to.description:
You can use fastai without any installation by using Google Colab. In
fact, every page of this documentation is also available as an
interactive notebook - click "Open in colab" at the top of any page to
open it (be sure to change the Colab runtime to "GPU" to have it run
fast!) See the fast.ai documentation on Using Colab for more
information.
dependent_to.name: py-fastai

dependent_to.description:
FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready
for production
dependent_to.name: py-fastapi

dependent_to.description: Flax: A neural network library for JAX designed for flexibility.
dependent_to.name: py-flax

The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Service provides a user

GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,

Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning

dependent_to.description: Galaxy Workflow Format 2 Descriptions

HAplotype and PHylodynamics pipeline for viral assembly, population

dependent_to.description:
Hatchet is a performance tool for analyzing hierarchical performance

This Python 3 library provides support for converting Old HepData input
format (sample) to YAML as well as YAML to ROOT, YODA and CSV.

dependent_to.description: Validation schema and code for HEPdata submissions.

dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

Client library to download and publish models, datasets and other repos

An extension to python's argparse which simplifies parsing of
configuration options from command line arguments, json configuration

defaults.
dependent_to.name: py-jsonargparse

dependent_to.description: Jupyter Event System library.

Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of

dependent_to.description: The deep learning framework to pretrain, finetune and deploy AI models.

A general purpose workflow conductor for running multi-step simulation

dependent_to.name: py-maestrowf

dependent_to.name: py-meautility

dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.
dependent_to.name: py-mikado

dependent_to.description:
mike is a Python utility to easily deploy multiple versions of your
MkDocs-powered docs to a Git branch, suitable for deploying to Github
via gh-pages.
dependent_to.name: py-mike

dependent_to.description:
MkDocs is a fast, simple and downright gorgeous static site generator

ML Collections is a library of Python collections designed for ML
usecases.
dependent_to.name: py-ml-collections

dependent_to.description: MLflow: A Platform for ML Development and Productionization.

dependent_to.description:
MMCV is a foundational python library for computer vision research and
supports many research projects in MMLAB, such as MMDetection and
MMAction.
dependent_to.name: py-mmcv

dependent_to.description:
Create a source of truth for ML model results and browse it on Papers
with Code
dependent_to.name: py-model-index

dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.
dependent_to.name: py-multiqc

dependent_to.description:
A Sphinx and Docutils extension to parse MyST, a rich and extensible
flavour of Markdown for authoring technical and scientific
documentation.
dependent_to.name: py-myst-parser

dependent_to.description: Minimalistic large language model 3D-parallelism training.

Blue Brain Nexus Forge is a domain-agnostic, generic and extensible

Reference implementation for the MLPerf HPC OpenCatalyst DimeNet++

dependent_to.name: py-ocp-models

A tool to help with the maintenance of container build scripts on
multiple systems, backends (e.g podman or apptainer) and distros.

dependent_to.description:
A hierarchical configuration system, with support for merging
configurations from multiple sources (YAML config files,

dependent_to.name: py-omegaconf

dependent_to.description: The Python library behind great charms

dependent_to.description:
Optuna is an automatic hyperparameter optimization software framework,
particularly designed for machine learning. It features an imperative,
define-by-run style user API. Thanks to our define-by-run API, the code
written with Optuna enjoys high modularity, and the user of Optuna can
dynamically construct the search spaces for the hyperparameters.
dependent_to.name: py-optuna

dependent_to.description:
Orbax includes a checkpointing library oriented towards JAX users,
supporting a variety of different features required by different
frameworks, including asynchronous checkpointing various types, and
various storage formats. We aim to provide a highly customizable and
composable API which maximizes flexibility for diverse use cases.
dependent_to.name: py-orbax-checkpoint

dependent_to.description:
The Oslo configuration API supports parsing command line arguments and
.ini style configuration files.
dependent_to.name: py-oslo-config

dependent_to.description:
OWSLib is a Python package for client programming with Open Geospatial
Consortium (OGC) web service (hence OWS) interface standards, and their
related content models.
dependent_to.name: py-owslib

dependent_to.description:
Ordered YAML: a drop-in replacement for PyYAML which preserves dict

dependent_to.description: Parametrize and run Jupyter and nteract Notebooks.

Phonopy is an open source package for phonon calculations at harmonic

dependent_to.description: Fast, flexible and easy to use probabilistic modelling in Python.

Convert reStructured Text to PDF via ReportLab. The usual way of

library.

A Python library that validates Swagger Specs against the Swagger 1.2

The TF-Keras library is a pure TensorFlow implementation of Keras, based
on the legacy tf.keras codebase. Note that the "main" version of Keras
is now Keras 3 (formerly Keras Core), which is a multi-backend
implementation of Keras, supporting JAX, PyTorch, and TensorFlow. Keras

State-of-the-art Natural Language Processing for TensorFlow 2.0 and

dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.
dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics

vcstool enables batch commands on multiple different vcs repositories.
Currently it supports git, hg, svn and bzr.

dependent_to.name: py-vcstools

dependent_to.description:
WAVES (LANL code C23004) is a computational science and engineering
workflow tool that integrates parametric studies with traditional
software build systems.

dependent_to.description:
Workload Automation (WA) is a framework for executing workloads and
collecting measurements on Android and Linux devices.
dependent_to.name: py-workload-automation

dependent_to.description:
A tool for managing a workspace of multiple heterogenous SCM
repositories.

Common set of tools used in weather workflows. See
https://wxflow.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ for documentation.

dependent_to.name: py-xmlplain

dependent_to.description: A YAML configuration manager.
dependent_to.name: py-yacman

dependent_to.description:
YACS was created as a lightweight library to define and manage system
configurations, such as those commonly found in software designed for
scientific experimentation.
dependent_to.name: py-yacs

dependent_to.description:
Yamlreader merges YAML data from a directory, a list of files or a file
glob.
dependent_to.name: py-yamlreader

dependent_to.description: yq takes YAML input, converts it to JSON, and pipes it to jq
dependent_to.name: py-yq

dependent_to.description: A YAML template engine with Python expressions.
dependent_to.name: py-yte

dependent_to.description: scalable pythonic model fitting for high energy physics
dependent_to.name: py-zfit

dependent_to.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.
dependent_to.name: qgis

dependent_to.description:
ReFrame is a framework for writing regression tests for HPC systems. The
goal of this framework is to abstract away the complexity of the
interactions with the system, separating the logic of a regression test
from the low-level details, which pertain to the system configuration
and setup. This allows users to write easily portable regression tests,
focusing only on the functionality.
dependent_to.name: reframe

dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute BLAS library
dependent_to.name: rocblas

dependent_to.description: Advanced Profiling and Analytics for AMD Hardware
dependent_to.name: rocprofiler-compute

dependent_to.description: ROCPROFILER library for AMD HSA runtime API extension support
dependent_to.name: rocprofiler-dev

dependent_to.description:
rocSPARSE exposes a common interface that provides Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines for sparse computation implemented on top of AMD's Radeon
Open eCosystem Platform ROCm runtime and toolchains. rocSPARSE is
created using the HIP programming language and optimized for AMD's
latest discrete GPUs.
dependent_to.name: rocsparse

dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations
dependent_to.name: sirius

dependent_to.description:
Workflow management system to create reproducible and scalable data
analyses.
dependent_to.name: snakemake

dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.
dependent_to.name: spectre

dependent_to.description:
Survey is a high level performance tool product from Trenza, Inc. The
survey collector/analytics framework is a new generation, high level,
lightweight multiplatform Linux tool set that targets metric collection
for high level performance analysis of applications running on both
single node and on large scale platforms, including the Cray platforms.
The collector is designed to work on sequential, MPI, OpenMP, and hybrid
codes and directly leverages several interfaces available for tools
inside current MPI implementations including: MPICH, MVAPICH, MPT, and
OpenMPI. It also supports multiple architectures and has been tested on
machines based on Intel, AMD, ARM, and IBM P8/9 processors and
integrated AMD and NVIDIA GPUs. Survey is a licensed product with the
source not openly available. To access the survey source and build with
spack please contact: Trenza Inc. via: dmont@trenzasynergy.com or
jeg@trenzasynergy.com
dependent_to.name: survey

dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python
dependent_to.name: timemory
